dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S836 IS: Family Health Care Flexibility Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Barrasso (for himself, Ms. Ayotte, Mr. Burr, Mr. Crapo, Mr. Isakson, Mr. Risch, Mr. Roberts, and Mr. Wicker) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal certain limitations on health care benefits enacted by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Family Health Care Flexibility Act.

section.header: Repeal of distributions for medicine qualified only if for prescribed drug or insulin

subsection.text: Subparagraph (A) of section 223(d)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the last sentence.
Subparagraph (A) of section 220(d)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the last sentence.

subsection.header: Health flexible spending arrangements and health reimbursement arrangements
subsection.text: Section 106 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking subsection (f).

paragraph.text: The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) shall apply to amounts paid with respect to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2015.
The amendment made by subsection (c) shall apply to expenses incurred with respect to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2015.

section.header: Repeal of limitation on health flexible spending arrangements under cafeteria plans

subsection.text: Section 125 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (j), (k), and (l) as subsections (i), (j), and (k), respectively.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2015.
